alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 5:36PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR CORNVILLE TO CAMP VERDE IN YAVAPAI COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MST... At 533 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near and along a line from Cornville to 5 miles south of Camp Verde , moving to the north and northeast between 5 and 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding can also be expected with unpaved roads becoming muddy and impassable. Locations impacted include... Camp Verde, Verde Lakes, Mcguireville, Rocking River Ranch State Park, Village At Oak Creek, Beaverhead Flat, V Bar V Heritage Site, Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area, Montezuma Castle National Monument, McGuireville, Hayfield Draw OHV Area, Fort Verde State Historic Park, Mormons Crossing Swimming Hole, Montezuma Well, Middle Verde, Jordan, Bullpen Day Use Area, House Mountain Trail Lookout, and Village of Oak Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 282 and 304. State Route 260 between mile markers 209 and 233. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
